title: Pay once, and never use Office 365 again—Office 2024 for Mac is just $129.97 (reg. $149.99)
content:
Macworld

If you’re a Mac user juggling between Pages, Google Docs, or costly Microsoft 365 subscriptions, here’s a smarter move. Microsoft Office 2024 Home for Mac is now available for a one-time price of $129.97 (reg. $149.99) until April 27 — no subscriptions, no recurring fees.

This lifetime license gives you the full desktop versions of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and OneNote. Unlike cloud-based apps, your files are stored locally, and you don’t need to be online to use them. That means fewer sync issues, faster access, and more control over your documents.

Reuters

Office 2024 also includes updates like smarter toolbars, accessibility improvements, and AI-powered suggestions that help polish your writing or visualize data in Excel. For students, families, or freelancers, it’s a practical, future-proof solution, and since it’s the latest version, you’re not missing out on modern features or compatibility.

Most importantly, this isn’t a stripped-down version. You get co-authoring tools, live commenting, and built-in version history all tied to your Microsoft account for easy access across devices. It’s a one-and-done investment that pays off month after month.

Grab Microsoft Office 2024 Home for Mac for $129.97 before the deal ends on April 27 at 11:59 p.m. PT and start saving every month you’re not paying for a subscription.
